Get started with exsampler

Source: vignettes/exsampler-get-started.Rmd
exsampler-get-started.Rmd

exsampler: Interactive normality visual inspector

Daniel Wikstrom

2025-08-17

Overview

This page provides an overview of the exsampler package.

exsampler is a tool to assist visual inspection of (non)normality. It displays a 3×3 grid where one panel contains the real data and the others contain simulated normal samples (Shapiro–Wilk p’s < 0.1) with the same mean/SD (and optionally the same rounding). You choose the variable, plot type, and whether simulations should match the original’s granularity.

Installation

Note: Replace the CRAN line when you publish.

# install.packages("exsampler")  # when on CRAN
# Development version from GitHub:
# remotes::install_github("wikstromd/exsampler")

Shiny app

Launch the app in demo mode (uses the package’s built‑in example data) with:

exsampler::run_app()

That’s it—no setup required.

What you’ll see

  • Histogram – with density and normal overlays.
  • QQ plot / Detrended QQ plot – compare sample quantiles to a normal reference.
  • PP plot – compare the empirical CDF to the normal CDF.
  • A 3×3 grid of panels – one panel contains the real data; the rest are simulated normal distributions (Shapiro Wilk p < 0.1) with the same mean/SD (and optionally the same rounding).

Click Generate Plots to create a fresh grid of simulations. The sidebar lets you choose the variable, plot type, and whether to match simulated data granularity (useful for integer‑like scales).

Confidence bands (from {qqplotr})

By default, no bands are shown (keeps the view uncluttered). You can toggle bands from the sidebar:

  • QQ plots: Pointwise, Bootstrap, Tail‑Sensitive (TS), or Kolmogorov–Smirnov (KS).
  • PP plots: Pointwise only.

All QQ and PP plots and their confidence bands are rendered using the {qqplotr} package (see: https://aloy.github.io/qqplotr/articles/introduction.html).

On this page
